Tommy Wiseau recorded all of The Room with a special rig that held two cameras at once, one digital and one film. He then recorded the whole thing on both and edited together scenes from each camera, even though they were capturing slightly different angles. He just wanted to be able to say he was the first to do so.

WRITING.TITLE: I Love You, Philip Morris is one of Jim Carrey's best films that I never hear talked about
WRITING.TEXT: This movie (based on a true story) is fantastic. The performances from Jim Carrey and Ewen McGregor are both great, and the true story its based on is so interesting and told so well in the film. It tells the story of a con man who escapes from prison countless times in order to be with the man he loves. It barely got released due to the homosexual content, but its a film that deserves so much recognition. Especially with how little good work Carrey is doing lately, this is one of his last great performances.
Have you seen the movie? Because I feel like your sarcasm is unjustified
I just feel like if people can say that Four Lions has been seen by no one that I can say it about this film I have never seen mentioned on here.

WRITING.TEXT: So you really put Johnny Depp above DiCaprio? Even though Depp has done like 2 good films in the past ten years? I also don't see how you can say DiCaprio always plays the same character when you think of how different he is in Wolf of Wall Street, to The Departed, to Django Unchained.
Also second choice for Captain America

Who would you have chosen then to play Professor X in the prequels, since it obviously couldn't have been Patrick Stewart? On DiCaprio, I couldn't disagree more that he wouldn't be where he is without Scorsese. Especially when you consider that the movie he did right before Gangs of New York (his first Scorsese movie) is arguably one of his best performances in Catch Me if You Can.

[FEEDBACK] My Summer With Cancer (Comedy/Drama Feature, Rough Draft, 35 pages)
WRITING.TEXT:
Hey guys, this is my first real attempt at writing a feature length script, and it's no where near completion of even the first draft but I was hoping someone could make sure I'm headed down the right track.
For a bit of background, this is the first 35 pages of an autobiographical script I am working on based on my experiences with having testicular cancer at such a young age. The tone I'm aiming for is a dark comedy, due to the fact that everyone around me always seemed to think things were worse than I did. Any feeedback at all would be appreciated, even though I am not very along into the timeline of the events yet.
If you would like to know more about what happens after what I have written so far, let me know.
Logline: After getting diagnosed with testicular cancer the summer before his senior year of high school, Matthew King tries to keep his sense of humour through increasingly unreal circumstances such as going through chemothereapy, a road trip with his mother to the sperm bank, and continuously unreliable doctors. What do you do when you feel fine but the world around you thinks you're on your deathbed? Link: https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B1XvK2MnD0aBR01VTkt5Y2YxSGc/view?usp=sharing
Please give it a read and let me know anything you think about it!
